pr_title: GEOS-9457: Restore the usage instruction of Windows Installer (only add ref to dev manual)

timeline.message: GEOS-9457: Added reference to instructions for building the Windows Installer and stating it's not longer provided

timeline.bodyText:
The wording is misleading, it's not the cost benefit per se, we need:

A well secured Windows server managed by a trusted organization that can host the OSGeo certificate used to sign installers. This alone would reinstate the presence of the installer in releases.
Someone to redo the installer from scratch, using Tomcat  instead of a reduced Jetty, to get a production worthy installer, instead of a demo oriented one. Not needed, but useful for those that actually want to run production on Windows.
timeline.author: aaime
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -17,3 +17,5 @@ There are many ways to install GeoServer on your system. This section will discu
    linux
    war
    upgrade
+
+.. note:: At this time we no longer provide a Windows Installer, because the benefics do not outstand the costs (it's basically a wrapper around the win_binary). However if you realy need the Windows installer, you can create one following `the instruction on this site <../../developer/win-installer.html>`.

replies.bodyText:
I was looking for a 'simple' an 'small' note, without a complete motivation.
Therefore I now replaced the 'specific' motivation by an 'open' motivation.
Or would you rather have this motivation written out?
If so, it would be best to have it outside the 'note' section?
replies.author: ronaldhoek

replies.bodyText: "At this time we no longer provide a Windows Installer, due to lack of a secure Windows machine where the installer can be built and signed" would be better.
replies.author: aaime

timeline.message: Removed the misleading motivation for not providing the installer and replace it with an 'open' motivation
Update note to give a minimal reason for not providing the Windows installer.
